ARABIC: ثُمَّ ٱجْتَبَٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَتَابَ عَلَيْهِ وَهَدَىٰ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But then his Lord chose him and turned to him and guided him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Then his Lord chose him and relented towards him, and showed him the way;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Thereafter his Lord exalted him, accepted his repentance, and bestowed guidance upon him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: His Lord forgave him, accepted his repentance, and gave him guidance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Then his Lord chose him, and inclined towards him with His mercy, and guided him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then his Lord chose him, and turned to him with forgiveness, and gave him guidance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then his Lord chose him, so He turned to him and guided (him).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Thereafter his Lord chose him, and turned again unto him, and He guided him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Then his Lord chose him, and relented toward him, and guided him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Then his Lord had mercy on him, accepted his repentance and guided him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Thereafter his Lord accepted him, and relented toward him, and guided him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Then his Lord chose him, and turned to him clemently, and guided him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But his Lord chose him (for His Grace): He turned to him, and gave him Guidance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then his Lord chose him, and turned to him with forgiveness, and gave him guidance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: But afterwards his Lord chose him; He turned again towards him and guided him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But then his Lord recalled him, and pardoned him, and guided him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then his Lord chose him and turned to him in forgiveness and guided [him].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [20:122]   Thereafter his Lord chose him, He brought him close [to Him], and relented to him, He accepted his repentance, and guided him, that is, He guided him to seek repentance regularly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Then his Lord chose him) by means of repentance, (and relented towards him) He overlooked his sin, (and guided him) to repentance.
